text:
- [Instructor] Now that we've
built out our application,

let's add front end
hosting to our project.
First, I'll create a repository.
And I'll push my code to it.
Now, I'll go back to the amplify console,
and where I launched Studio before,

I'll actually switch over to
the hosting environments tab.
I'll host a web app from GitHub.
Authorize GitHub,
and then I'll choose my GitHub repository.
I'll deploy from my main branch.
I'll choose the staging environment,
and then I'll choose a backend role.
You may need to create a new one.
If so, just click next,

and then create, then back
in here choose that role.
Then click save and deploy.
Now that my application's deployed,

I can open it up and
share it with anybody.

In this video we successfully
deployed a React application
to AWS via amplify hosting.
